description: Autonomous Optimization insights combining regression, classification, and forecasting for login-service between Nov 2024 and Nov 2025.

models.narrative: The regression model achieved R² = 0.94, indicating that 94% of latency variance is explained by system metrics. Response time rises sharply when TPS exceeds 220 or CPU utilization surpasses 70%. Adding replicas quickly reduces latency.
models.action_recommendation: Monitor CPU > 70% or TPS > 220; pre-scale replicas +1 before expected surge; target latency < 500 ms.
models.embedding_text: Login-service regression model explains 94% latency variance. TPS, CPU%, and Memory% strongly influence response time...

cause_effect_pairs.effect: System likely to enter Critical state

models.narrative: The XGBoost classifier achieved 99.96 % accuracy in labeling system health as Healthy, Degrading, or Critical. Response-time spikes, memory pressure, and high CPU utilization are key predictors of saturation. The model distinguishes these states almost perfectly.
models.action_recommendation: Trigger auto-scaling or alerts when Degrading/Critical probability > 0.8 for three consecutive intervals.
models.embedding_text: Login-service health classification predicts Healthy/Degrading/Critical states with 99.9% accuracy. High latency and resource usage drive Degrading/Critical states.

cause_effect_pairs.effect: Higher sustainable TPS with lower latency

models.narrative: The forecasting model predicts a 20 % TPS increase between 10 AM and 2 PM, followed by a 25 % drop after 8 PM and during weekends. It captures recurring daily traffic cycles, enabling proactive scaling.
models.action_recommendation: Pre-scale pods +2 at 09:45 AM to absorb the morning surge; scale down after 8 PM or during weekends by 25%.
models.embedding_text: Login-service forecasting model anticipates 20 % TPS rise between 10 AM–2 PM and weekend dip of 25 %. Suggest scaling up 2 replicas before morning peak.
